text.__SUMMARY__: Albizia ferruginea (locally known as musase) is a species of plant in the family Fabaceae. It is found in Angola, Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Central African Republic, the Republic of the Congo, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ivory Coast, Gabon, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Nigeria, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Togo, and Uganda. It is threatened by deforestation.
text.References: Hawthorne, W. 1998.  Albizia ferruginea. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 20 August 2007.
